environment.GUI.views

Class Animated.AnimationPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • environment.GUI.views.Animated.AnimationPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Enclosing class:
    Animated

    public static class Animated.AnimationPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The AnimationaPanel class is a subclass of the JPanel class which is designed for drawing visual representations of the Station objects.

    The Animated.AnimationPanel has an Image which is used to draw the Station, and is responsible for mainly structuring and organising the visual representation of the Station visual representation.

    Since:
    01/04/2017
    Version:
    21/04/2017
    Author:
    John Berg
    See Also:
    JPanel, Image, Graphics, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        The serial ID of the Animated.AnimationPanel.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LEFT_MARGIN

        private static final int LEFT_MARGIN
        The amount of space between the main area of the Animated.AnimationPanel and the left side of Animated.AnimationPanel.

        The LEFT_MARGIN reserves space for information about the simulation to be displayed.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BLOCK_SIZE

        public static final int BLOCK_SIZE
        The size of the area which is usable when drawing the Location objects.

        Each Location is assigned an area of equal size, where the size is also used to organise how the Location objects are placed on the screen.

        The area usable by each Location is: 80*80

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TEXT_FONT

        private static final java.awt.Font TEXT_FONT
        The Font used by the Animated.AnimationPanel.

        The default Font which is used by the Animated.AnimationPanel and the size of the Font.

        See Also:
        Font

      • size

        private final java.awt.Dimension size
        The current width and height of the Animated.AnimationPanel.

        The Dimension containing the current width and height of this Animated.AnimationPanel which allows the img to match the size of the Animated.AnimationPanel.

        See Also:
        Dimension

      • img

        private java.awt.Image img
        The Image which will be drawn on.

        The Image object which the Animated.AnimationPanel uses to draw the simulation.

        See Also:
        Image

      • g

        private java.awt.Graphics g
        The graphics to be drawn to the img.

        The Graphics object which id used to draw the Station object to the img.

        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnimationPanel

        public AnimationPanel(int width,
                      int height)
        Create a new Animated.AnimationPanel.

        Initialise a Animated.AnimationPanel by providing the initial width and height of the panel.

        Parameters:
        width - The height of the Animated.AnimationPanel.
        height - The width of the Animated.AnimationPanel.

    • Method Detail

      • prepareDraw

        private void prepareDraw()
        Prepare the Animated.AnimationPanel before drawing.

        Preparations involve:

        1. Initialise the img if null or if the this panel's size has been changed
        2. Get the Graphics of the img
        3. Draw a green rectangle as a background

      • drawInfo

        private final void drawInfo(java.lang.String[] lines)
        Draw a table of RoadUser classes with their associated Color.

        Drawing the table involves:

        1. Drawing a "Colors:" label.
        2. Drawing a colored square
        3. Drawing the name of the RoadUser

        The table is created at the bottom of the Animated.AnimationPanel where each entry is added as a row; if the entry exceeds the width of the img then the entry will wrap to the next row of the table.

        See Also:
        Color, RoadUser

      • getEffectiveWidth

        private int getEffectiveWidth()
        Get the width which the Animated.AnimationPanel can use to draw the visual representation of the simulation.
        Returns:
        The usable width of the Animated.AnimationPanel for visualising the simulation.

      • draw

        public void draw(int time,
                 Station station)
        Draw a Station object to this Animated.AnimationPanel.

        Draw a Station object by:

        1. Calling the prepareDraw() method
        2. Grouping the Location objects (groupLocations(List))
        3. Calculating the spacing between Location objects
        4. Drawing each Location from the grouped Location objects at the next position.

        The specific visual representation for the Location object is stored in the Animated.Visualisation enum, which can be accessed by calling the Animated.Visualisation.getVisual(Class) method.

        Parameters:
        station - The Station to be drawn to the Animated.AnimationPanel.
        See Also:
        Station, Animated.Visualisation, Animated.Visualisation.getVisual(Class)

      • groupLocations

        private java.util.List<java.util.List<Location>> groupLocations(java.util.List<Location> locations)
        Group a List of Location objects into a List objects of Location objects which exist in parallel.

        Convert a List of Location objects into a List of List of Location objects which represent the Location objects which exist in parallel during the simulation.

        A groups of Location objects must share the same Location.nextLocation, Location objects which meet this requierment will be placed in the same group as the other Location object with the same next Location; otherwise the Location is placed in the next group.

        Parameters:
        locations - A List of Location objects.
        Returns:
        A List of List objects containing locations which exist in parallel.
        See Also:
        List, Location
